India has an expansive history of legal aid, backed by several decades of legislation, jurisprudential interpretation, and numerous state-funded programs. India’s laws strongly support the provision of pro bono legal services.

The Constitution of India, national legislation, and its Supreme Court jurisprudence together articulate an aspiration for broadly accessible legal aid. We provide pro bono services to the people marginalized on the basis of class, caste, disability, gender or sexuality for their civil, political, economic, social, cultural and environmental rights.

We believe that lawyers can play an important role in protection of rights of people who cannot afford to come to the Court of law or who cannot afford the high fees of the Lawyer to represent their case in the Court of Law.

excerpt.rendered: We provide Fee Consultation to poor and needy. Our vision is to make legal aid accessible, affordable and time bound.
